Key Match Events: Wales made a lightning start with Kieffer Moore striking inside 38 seconds and Harry Wilson adding an improvised, superb second from about 25 yards less than two minutes later.
Montenegro got their reward, feasting on some slack defending as Krstovic squared for Camaj to convert from close range.
Pre-Game Insights: This match was due to be played in Podgorica but a fortnight ago the game was moved to Niksic, 45 minutes away by car, because Uefa held concerns over the pitch.
Post-Match Reflections: It was hard not to think Montenegro’s players were affected by the emotional minute’s applause for their former goalkeeper, Matija Sarkic, who died aged 26 in June.
What did I make of it? Wet!” said the manager, whose side have taken four points from their opening two Nations League matches and return to action against Iceland in Reykjavik in October.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch, ringfenced by a running track, had survived biblical rainstorms that prompted local power cuts but worsened throughout and by half-time it resembled a hazard-awareness course.
For Wales supporters, tricolour bucket hats helped shelter from incessant downpours.
Others: The match was played in dreadful conditions with heavy rain and a poor pitch, but Wales managed to secure a 2-1 win.
Montenegro's players were visibly affected by the emotional minute's applause for their former goalkeeper, Matija Sarkic.
